user.biography:
Can you imagine waking up to a world without lions? Follow my journey and together let’s make sure that never happens 🦁
@craghoppers

node.text:
Is there anything more spectacular than the echoing roar of a lion? This #WildlifeWednesday is all about the ROAR! Join me as we explore just how powerful and far-reaching these roars are!
#lionroars #canyouhearmenow #pride #120decibels

node.text:
Pretty much everybody here knows that I live in the @craghoppers NosiLife Adventure shirt. It might look like an ordinary shirt but it has so many great features that help me every day. A shirt that stands up to the punishment the lions dish out, will definitely stand the test of any adventure! Comment a 👕  emoji if you'd love to try it too!
#mycraghoppers #mindfullymade #craghoppersambassador #craghoppers #nosilifeadventureshirt

node.text:
So I’m often asked why I move the lions in my care around? The answer is simple. Imagine living your entire life in one area, like that of a lion living in a zoo. Lions thrive on having access to new environments, which brings new stimulations, smells and sights. It’s really only because of my relationships that moving is a stress free occurrence which would otherwise need veterinary intervention and anaesthesia. This makes frequent moves in other facilities infrequent. I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again, ‘we should be aiming for less and less lions being kept in captivity and aiming for more and more lions in the wild through habitat protection and preservation.’ When the lions in my care pass on, I will not be replacing them, even with rescues. Instead the lion camps will be used for rehabilitation of wild carnivores and once rehabilitated will be released back into the wild. 

#neighbour #neighbours #kevinrichardson #animalwelfare #betterlife #wildlife #responsibility #lionsofinstagram 
#lions #mycraghoppers #mindfullymade 
@craghoppers

node.text: Nyeba had loads of fun out on his walk today. It was extremely hot and humid however he sniffed out this pool of water left from the heavy rains of late and went for a well deserved goof. How can you not love hyena after watching Nyeba fool around in the water! Enjoy the video and the next time you see a hyena in the wild,(hopefully soon 🙏🏼) stop and give it the attention it deserves! #hyena #hyenaofinstagram #spottedhyena #yearofthehyena #hyenawhisperer #lionwhisperertv #kevinrichardson #kevinrichardsonfoundation #kevinrichardsonwildlifesanctuary

node.text: A few weeks back I posted a couple of photos from this scene and many of you asked if I’d taken any video and if I’d post it. Here it is. 6 lions cooperatively feeding on an impala carcass. Listen to the sounds and take them in. It’s not often you get this close to lions eating like this. The canines have served their purpose and now it’s up to the incisors and the carnassial teeth to do their jobs.

node.text:
What comes after the Pandemic? This video message from the virus to humankind is a chilling reminder that our future is intimately connected with all other life on Earth. We know where the pandemic came from and we know how to stop the next one. It's time to make our voices heard. Enough is enough. Now that our own vulnerability has been laid bare, it's time to demand #ExtinctionEndsHere -- for all life on Earth.

TAKE ACTION: ExtinctionEndsHere.org

Video: @SeaLegacy & @global_wildlife_conservation

node.text: My good friend @kimwolhuter posted an excellent video on Instagram TV which I suggest you all watch. The other day we met for coffee and decided 2020 should be the year of the hyena. There are still so many myths and misconceptions surrounding this unique and incredible species. “In the end we will conserve only what we love, we will love only what we understand, and we will understand only what we are taught.” Baba Dioum #yearofthehyena #hyenasarecool #hyenasofinstagram  #protecthyena #hyena #hyaena #spottedhyena

node.text: Recently, I was asked out to dinner by my partners @mercedesbenzsa as they got ready for their 2019 Eat Out Mercedes- Benz Restaurant Awards coming up on November 17th.  @marble_sa chef @davidhiggschef knew just what to serve. What would you serve me if I was coming for dinner?

node.title: A dinner fit for a Lionwhisperer

node.text:
And then there were 8! The miracle 5 is now the miracle 8! How on earth did that happen? Well, you’ll have to watch the full video to find out. Huge shout out to everyone who donated to the #Miracle5 campaign to help bring these sweet cubs into adulthood and rewild them. If you missed your chance, there’s still time to donate, simply click the link in our Contact in Bio, as well, for the full video on #LionwhispererTV you’ll find the link there.
Wishing you all a fabulous weekend, stay safe, stay sane, stay caffeinated!

#cheetahcubs #cheetahs #themiracle8 #rewilding #intothewild

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Kevin Richardson on August 20, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, animal and outdoors.

node.text: Being human is what makes us want to connect with animals. It’s in our DNA 🧬 This is why we have animals that are domesticated. Your pet dog is a result of around 18000 years of selective breeding. Hell, can you just imagine what the humans back then must’ve thought of the first dude deciding to befriend a wolf? He/she must’ve been the ‘talk of the town’. Naturally my interactions with the lions, leopards and hyena sometimes causes a similar stir. I think what’s important to understand and this is where the education comes in, is that animals that have unique bonds with humans didn’t happen overnight. In the case of my relationship with Livy (pictured) it’s been well over a decade and in the case of your pet pooch, around 18000! The point being is that we should always look at animal human relationships in context and with the understanding that my relationships with the lions may not be possible for you, just like someone else’s relationship with an elephant may not be possible for me. Both these animals are as lethal as each other when disrespected. So for me, I’ll continue to give the animals in my care the best lives in captivity as I possibly can for as long as I possibly can and yes that includes touching them 😱. Have a wonderful weekend everyone and remember to be weary of people who dislike animals.

node.text:
Even in play the musculature of an adult lion is formidable. So many of you ask about the importance of our enrichment walks, and the truth is that for any confined animal, those walks are the difference between life in captivity and life in a sanctuary.  By taking them out into the bigger area and giving them the opportunity to hone the skills they would have needed for survival in the wild, not only are we supporting their mental health, but their physical health as well. 
.
.
.
.
.
#wildlife #lions #sanctuary #enrichment #reconnectwithnature

node.text:
No matter how many animals we have at the sanctuary, nothing beats actually getting out into the bush and experiencing the natural beauty of Africa. Today we’re sharing the best of my recent trip to @rockfig_safari_lodge. Special thanks to Cameron Scott – Safari Guide and Photographer @camscott_wild, Christof Schoeman @christofschoeman_wildlife – Safari Guide Rockfig Safari Lodge and Isaac Mathonsi – Tracker Rockfig Safari Lodge. For the full video on #lionwhisperertv click the link above in our Contact in Bio. Have a great weekend, get outside and breathe!
.
.
.
.
#safari #safarilife #africa #southafrica #lions #hippos #giraffes #getoutside #breathedeeply  #digitaldetox #weekends #rockfigsafarilodge #rockfig #timbavati #wildlife

node.text:
Is there anything more spectacular than the echoing roar of a lion? This #WildlifeWednesday is all about the ROAR! Join me as we explore just how powerful and far-reaching these roars are!
#lionroars #canyouhearmenow #pride #120decibels

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Kevin Richardson on August 10, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, big cat and outdoors.

node.text:
Happy #worldlionday everyone! To say lions mean the world to me is an understatement. Where do I even start without making this the longest post ever? To put how important lions are into perspective, today on World Lion Day I had the privilege of being in the #krugernationalpark and spent the morning watching two lions, already fully engorged, take turns defending an elephant carcass from what seemed like 50 hyenas chomping at the bit trying to sneak a tiny morsel when the opportunity presented itself. 

The lions were eating with long teeth and every bite was an effort and a strain. All that aside, what made for even more entertaining viewing was what seemed like 50 cars all competing for the same piece of dirt road, trying to get a glimpse and perhaps a cell phone pic or two of these two, blood-soaked, hardly glamorous acting ‘kings of the jungle’ while they burped, farted and could hardly even rollover due to their distended and bloated abdomens. 

But as I sat there witnessing this whole scene play out, it yet again, as if I ever needed reminding, made me realize just how important lions are when it comes to the role they play in keeping our National Parks filled with tourists. Without these iconic animals roaming around, these wilderness areas would lose so much of their attractiveness. Now, this is just one aspect of the many important roles lions play in the health of the environment. 

I’m so proud that my foundation (@kevinrichardsonfoundation )has played an important role this World Lion Day, by sponsoring a lion statue (adorned with beautiful images of many of the sanctuaries lions by @davidyarrow) in the #liontrail initiative by @tusk_org, the proceeds of which will support the lion projects @tusk_org support in East Africa, Namibia, Botswana and Zambia. So in their small way, the sanctuary lions have played a role in preserving the future of their wild counterparts. 

Please check this out on @tusk_org social, like, share and spread the message far and wide
My foundation has also proudly relaunched our Youth Ambassador Program today!

#lion #lioness #lionconservation #conservation #worldlionday2021 #worldlionday #tuskliontrail

node.text:
Have you ever wondered why humans squint to see things in the distance, but lions don’t? If you are nearsighted, the light rays focus in front of the retina and you have difficulty seeing objects at a distance. ... however, squinting helps because it decreases the amount of light that passes through the lens. 

As for lions, the white stripe under their eyes helps reflect faint light into the eyes, making it easier to see under low light conditions. It also helps in mottled lighting, common in dense, bushy areas. Good thing I don’t have to rely on my eyesight to eat!

.
.
.
#vision #timeforglasses #lions #africa #southafrica #safar #sanctuarycats #apexpredators

node.text:
Why do they grow up so fast?! Seems like just yesterday we welcomed these six beautiful cubs into our lives to help teach the world about canned hunting and now they are full-on adults! Join me as I head out with Thor’s pride and learn what makes each of these cats complete individuals. For the full video on #LionwhispererTV click the link above in my Contact in Bio.  Wishing you all a fabulous weekend, take the time to stop and smell the roses, spend time with family and friends, enjoy the weather and take that #digitaldetox. See you all back here on Monday!
.
